result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Lazzarus Lyontae Hunt not in court.  Attorney Thomas James appeared by video for Lazzarus Lyontae Hunt.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case in court for status conference. Court waives defendant's appearance as defendant did appear on zoom earlier and dropped off.
Defense counsel has received discovery and offer and requests additional time to review. 
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 15.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Lazzarus Lyontae Hunt not in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Pretrial Conference.  Attorney Kline appears but has not been appointed on this case.
Court ordered matter adjourned to track with defendant pending matter. Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Lazzarus Lyontae Hunt in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Defendant Lazzarus Lyontae Hunt in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.  This hearing will be streamed Live through DACAST:
